steps: Participants are assigned to pairs consisting of a Proposer (Player 1) in Room A and an anonymous Receiver (Player 2) in Room B.
Proposers are asked to divide a pie ($5 or $10) between themselves and the Receiver using a proposal form.
In the Ultimatum Game condition, the Receiver is given the chance to accept or reject the proposal. If accepted, the money is divided as specified; if rejected, both receive zero.
In the Dictator Game condition, the Receiver has no power to reject the offer, and the Proposer's division is automatically enforced.
In the Pay condition, participants are paid their share of the pie in cash plus a $3 participation fee.
In the No Pay condition, participants are informed the division is hypothetical and they only receive the $3 participation fee.
